org.block.project.block

Interface Block

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Block.AttachableBlock, Block.AttachableBlock.StatementBlock, Block.CalledBlock, Block.CalledBlock.CodeStartBlock, Block.LinkedBlock, Block.SpecificSectionBlock, Block.TextBlock, Block.ValueBlock<V>, Block.ValueBlock.ConnectedValueBlock<V>, Block.ValueBlock.ConnectedValueBlock.MutableConnectedValueBlock<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAttachable, AbstractBlock, AbstractNumberOperation, AbstractText, AbstractValue, BooleanBlock, IntegerBlock, MethodBlock, NumberBlock, StringBlock, SumOperation, VariableBlock

    public interface Block
    A Block is a shape that can have specific functions with code attached to it. The idea of the Block is very abstract so please look at the classes that extend upon the Block interface for a more specific description

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Block.AttachableBlock
      If the Block requires additional information to function properly that is in code form, then it should implement Attachable.
      static interface  Block.CalledBlock
      If your code requires calls to be added into the output code project, then this should be implemented.
      static interface  Block.LinkedBlock
      If a block is directly affected by another block then the former should implement this.
      static interface  Block.SpecificSectionBlock
      If the block has specific sections to add to the chooser, then it requires to implement this.
      static interface  Block.TextBlock
      If the Block has some text to be shown then this should be implemented Most blocks will implement this
      static interface  Block.ValueBlock<V>
      If the block has a output value, then this should be implemented which will allow the Block to be added as a parameter.

      Gets the BlockType for this block, it may not be the block type that was used to create the block, however it will be of the same type.

      • isShowingError

        boolean isShowingError()
        Reports the block as having an error. Only the paint implementation should need to check this
        Returns:
        Is showing an error

      • setShowingError

        void setShowingError(boolean error)
        Sets if the block should be showing an error, the blocks own implementation should not be calling this
        Parameters:
        error - If the block has an error.

      • getEvents

        Gets the attached events
        Returns:
        Gets a unordered unmodifiable list of BlockEvent

      • registerEventListener

        void registerEventListener(EventListener<? extends BlockEvent> event)
        Register a event to the block. Note that these are not saved by default, implementations may save some
        Parameters:
        event - The new event to register

      • getUniqueId

        java.util.UUID getUniqueId()
        Gets a unique id for the block. This is used for checking if the block is equal as well as used for dependents when saving and loading. When loaded/unloaded the block will maintain its ID
        Returns:
        The unique id

      • paint

        void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics2D)
        This draws the block to the provided graphics in a Vector like painting style
        Parameters:
        graphics2D - The vector rendering local

      • writeCode

        java.lang.String writeCode(int tabs)
        This writes the calling/in line code for the block. The first line should not have a tab indent, however other lines should have the tab indent
        Parameters:
        tabs - The indent to provide
        Returns:
        The output code

      • getCodeImports

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getCodeImports()
        Provides each import required in string form, no need for "import" therefore a example would be the following "java.long.String"
        Returns:
        A collection of imports

      • getAttachedTo

        java.util.Optional<Block.AttachableBlock> getAttachedTo()
        Gets the block that this block is attached to
        Returns:
        The block this is attached to, if none then Optional.empty() will be returned

      • setAttachedTo

        void setAttachedTo(Block.AttachableBlock block)
        Sets the block that this is attached to, to remove the block it is currently attached to provide 'null' (however it is prefered to use removeAttachedTo() just in case this changes)
        Parameters:
        block - The block that is attaching this

      • getType

        BlockType<?> getType()
        Gets the BlockType for this block, it may not be the block type that was used to create the block, however it will be of the same type.
        Returns:
        The BlockType for the block

      • getLayer

        int getLayer()
        This is the layer to show on the panel, the higher the layer then the more blocks this block will appear ontop of. By default the layer should be 0, with the implementation that built the block then setting it the value to the highest current layer. The layer will be changed based on other blocks being selected, hovered, dragged, etc however this will be done on the panels implementation. This just needs to store the value
        Returns:
        The current layer the block is on.

      • setLayer

        void setLayer(int layer)
        Sets the layer to show on the panel, the higher the layer then the more blocks this block will appear ontop of. Note. This value should not be changed while the block is on the BlockDisplayPanel as the layer is what is compared using the TreeSet. Use BlockDisplayPanel.updateBlockPosition(Consumer) to update the layer.
        Parameters:
        layer - The new layer.

      • update

        default void update()
        Updates the block and all things connected to the block by default, this updates the layer on the panel

      • delete

        default void delete()
        Deletes the block from the panel, does all the checks to remove everything correctly

      • removeAttachedTo

        default void removeAttachedTo()
        Removes the definition of this block being attached to another

                         int y)
        Checks to see if the provided X and Y is contained within the Block
        Parameters:
        x - The X position to check
        y - The Y position to check
        Returns:
        If contained, the result will be true.
